question: Able, Baker, and Charlie live on a remote island and rely entirely on _______ for sustenance.
Catching a fish takes an entire _______ of labor using their bare hands.
Able dreams of creating a _______ to improve fishing efficiency.
Able sacrifices _______ consumption to create a tool for the future.
A fishing net is an example of _______ in economic terms.
Tools amplify human _______, allowing more to be produced with the same effort.
The first surplus on the island occurred when Able caught _______ fish.
Surplus food enables the _______ of activities like building shelter.
The _______ Revolution introduced tools like plows to support farming.
Without tools, humanity would return to basic _______ methods.
